page.title: 06TRANSPORT, SOUTH FEN/TWENTY
page.content: For a person without a car living in this corner of Lincolnshire can be a very daunting experience. There are no shops, public houses or any other form of amenity and the nearest towns are four and seven miles away at Bourne and Spalding respectively. There is a limited bus service run by the Delaine Bus Company from Bourne to Twenty on three days of the week, Tuesday and the Bourne market days of Thursday and Saturday. At present the subsidized adult return fare from Bourne to Twenty is 40 pence. The previously convenient rail con- nection to both Bourne and Spalding was finally closed in 1965. There is no regular bus service bet ween Bourne and South Fen/Tongue End. However, children at both hamlets receive free transport to schools in Bourne.
